search.query: `dmc_set_index_internal` host=$splunk_server$ source=*splunkd.log CacheManager AND action=* AND earliest=-1h | stats count(eval(status="failed")) as txn_failed, count(eval(status="succeeded")) as txn_succeeded | eval available=case(txn_failed=0 AND txn_succeeded=0, "IDLE", txn_succeeded>0, "ONLINE", true(), "OFFLINE") | fields - txn_failed - txn_succeeded

html.p: IDLE means no remote activity has happened in the last hour.

search.query: | rest splunk_server=$splunk_server$ /services/admin/cacheman | eval stable_size = if('cm:bucket.stable'=1, 'cm:bucket.estimated_size', 0) | stats sum(stable_size) as stable_bytes, sum(cm:bucket.estimated_size) as all_bytes | eval migration_progress=round((stable_bytes / all_bytes) * 100) | fields - stable_bytes - all_bytes

panel.html: This tracks progress when migrating data from non-SmartStore to SmartStore. Otherwise ignore this.

search.query: `dmc_set_index_internal` host=$splunk_server$ group=cmmaster source=*metrics.log subgroup=buckets_re_creation | stats sum(success_count) as successes, sum(in_progress_count) as in_progress | eval total = successes + in_progress | eval percent = if(total=0, 100, (1 - ((in_progress - successes) / total)) * 100) | fields percent

panel.html: This tracks progress when bootstrapping data from remote storage onto indexers. Otherwise, ignore this.

search.query: `dmc_set_index_internal` host=$splunk_server$ source=*splunkd.log ((action=download AND download_set=*tsidx*) OR action=upload) status=succeeded component=CacheManager | eval mb = kb / 1024 | timechart $funcAggregate$(mb) by action

html.p: Each new warm bucket gets uploaded to remote storage. Buckets are only downloaded if they're required for a search and are not already in the local cache. High download rates are a negative indicator of cache health

search.query: `dmc_set_index_internal` host=$splunk_server$ group=cachemgr_* | eval group_str=case(group="cachemgr_download", "Download", group="cachemgr_upload", "Upload") | timechart sum(failed) by group_str

panel.html: Failures are only reported here after retries have been exhausted. Failures may require further investigation.

chart.title: Remote Storage Http Error Status Codes

search.query: `dmc_set_index_internal` host=$splunk_server$ source=*splunkd.log S3Client | search statusCode=* | eval status = statusCode.": ".statusDescription | timechart count by status

panel.html: These should roughly correspond with the upload/download failures.
